entry.title: So This Is How Multiverse Lawsuits Start
entry.summary:
Author: MaskSoully

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,786Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 49

Summary: You’re fictional,” Francesca says, already regretting it. Superman stares at her.Batman exhales “I suspected,” he says.“YOU WHAT,” Francesca shrieks.Bruce Wayne sets her phone on the counter. Her phone. The one she didn't even notice was missing. “There are films about us.”Clark goes very, very still.Francesca covers her face with her hands. “I’m so sorry. Don't tell me you went into Twitter,” Francesca gasps, "Don't tell me you went into Ao3"Bruce quirked his eyebrow in response. "Oh man..."Francesca was just a girl. A normal girl. Definitely a little too online. More enamored with a world filled with superheroes and powers. Worlds she could never touch.Until Superman and Batman appear in her kitchen.Now Francesca is tangled in something much bigger than fandom and fiction: a government conspiracy, impossible technology, and the unsettling realization that these two men didn’t cross worlds because of a threat in theirs—But because someone in hers figured out how to pull them through.

entry.title: Two Heroes and a Baby
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 88,196Chapters: 24/?Kudos: 473

Summary: In this AU, 19-year-old Bruce Wayne adopts 4-year-old Dick Grayson after he is orphaned by a tragic event at Haly's Circus. Bruce is in over his head trying to juggle establishing himself as a responsible and valuable asset to Wayne Enterprises, beginning his vigilante work in Gotham as The Batman, and parenting a young child despite not knowing where to start. After struggling to get good press and constantly being seen as an irresponsible nepo baby, he sets up an interview at The Daily Planet. That's where he meets 19-year-old intern Clark Kent, who is eager to write a good story to begin his career as a journalist. After Clark agrees to keep an eye on Dick during his interview, Bruce realizes he has a knack for watching children, especially young Dick Grayson. Bruce asks Clark to come live with him at Wayne Manor on a 6 month assignment as Dick's nanny, and in return, will let Clark write the story of a lifetime--an expose on his life that no other reporter has even come close to. Clark reluctantly agrees, but is hiding a secret from Bruce--his life as the superhero, Superman! As the two begin their friendship and double lives as heroes, they learn valuable lessons in friendship, love, and parenting.

entry.title: And Now It Follows Me Everyday
entry.summary:
Author: theFamousLivingDead

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 45,105Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 91

Summary: Gotham has a reputation that precedes itself, but these days even her city limits are overrun with chaos. The streets are littered with rumors about a new shape above the skyline. The docks have been taken over by gangs and civilians are forced to keep to a curfew for their own safety. Bruce Wayne is stumped when all his attempts to prevent crime from taking off in Gotham are thwarted by a lightningfast shadow. His worst nightmare comes true -- there is someone else out there, more powerful than he could ever train himself to be, and he's not on his side of history. In which Clark Kent went out to find more about himself and his origins, but the League of Assassins found him first.

entry.title: Goldwing
entry.summary:
Author: fonziesprettycool

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,021Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 282

Summary: "You almost got expelled. Again," Alfred practically cursed. "Every Wayne before you attended Gotham's private academy. I had to make a proposition to keep you in, Bruce. You might not like it, but I’ve convinced the board that it'll teach you control, and it's much better than being in Arkham Asylum." "Everyone wishes I was there," Bruce scoffed. "They want me locked away to rot like...like mom did. But I have control." Alfred suddenly chuckled. It was off putting. "Do you?" He asked, with thinly veiled anger. "You smashed a boys head into brick. He's getting intensive surgery because he called you orphan boy." Bruce froze. His anger fizzled away. "I-I didn't know," he whispered lowly. He realized how he looked to others; a crazed recluse, a violent teenager, a quiet ticking bomb who had all the negative traits of his mother and father combined into one. Bruce swallowed down his guilt and asked his final question. “What’s the proposition?” * In which seventeen year old Bruce Wayne has one last chance to restore what's left of his image; working as an assistant to Clark Kent, his father’s former friend, and current Chief of the Daily Planet.

entry.title: Even If We Both Break Down
entry.summary:
Author: Holdt

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,780Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 36

Summary: Bruce Wayne is the world's greatest detective. He can solve any crime, track any criminal, predict any outcome. But when it comes to love, he only knows one equation: caring equals loss.Now Clark's patience is wearing thin, and Bruce is finally forced to confront what he's been cataloguing all along: you can't protect someone by making them feel worthless. Sometimes the only thing more terrifying than losing someone is realizing you're losing them by choice.A character study about apologizing, about learning to be present instead of perfect, and about two men figuring out that love isn't a tactical problem to be solved—it's a choice to be made, again and again, even when the math says it's safer to run.
